embeds.title: Swift Strike

messages.content: only normal basic strikes
ok
that's good for what I wrote in the tips doc with hermit 2
however, in this hypothetical scenario, bruise, vigor, strength, and reserves would all scale snapshot

I think this card is just awful. You can take it to help you power through act 1, where it is at least good against the elites and short hallway fights, but it gets so much worse as the run progresses. More importantly, hermit already has plenty of good tools to get them through act 1 effectively, including several front-loaded damage cards that do transition at least somewhat gracefully into the late game. These include, but are not limited to golden bullet, grudge, memento, high caliber, showdown, enervate, misfire, spray n’ pray, and headshot. I can’t think of any other card in slay the spire with such a short lifespan of usefulness. As soon as you start to remove even 1 or 2 strikes/defends, and especially once you have added 4-5 other new cards to your deck, short fuse starts to fall off a cliff. I would rather take basically every other front-loaded damage common and uncommon over this, because they don’t have anti-synergy with hermit’s entire card pool.

Even in a deck featuring showdown, maintenance, and other synergy pieces, this will usually just get in the way. It’s really bad if you are paying 3 energy, and just okay at 2 energy (and you had to spend at least 1 energy playing a strike or defend, so your output for the turn is bad overall even then). You will have a very difficult time reducing it’s cost below 2 once you’ve added even a decent number of cards to your deck. It also has to be one of the worst cards possible to transform into, as you just removed one of its few support pieces at the same time. You can run it with Necronomicon or snecko eye (the cost still gets reduced by playing strikes/defends as you play them), but I think it has very little application outside of that, and there are far better things to combo with necro on hermit (No holds barred, roulette).

I think this is probably hermit's worst card, maybe even one of the worst cards in all of downfall. It has no utility outside of early game damage (which is basically never a problem for hermit), it doesn't support it's own strike/defend synergies well, and it gets worse and worse as the run goes on and you add new cards and remove strikes/defends. Most frontloaded damage cards have some trouble staying relevant late in the run, but this one in particular falls off completely. Something that's really important to do in STS is to find solutions for the early game that can still contribute to an engine/scaling later on (transitioning gracefully) and this card is awful at doing that.
Honestly im baffled at this doing ***LESS*** damage than <sunder>

messages.content: its easier to play strikes because of cards like take cover, high noon, and showdown probably

~~scaling defense with maintenance by using dex~~
scaling defense with maintenance by increasing snapshot damage
okay now on to short fuse. This is an act 1 damage card that doesn't just scale poorly into lategame, it scales backwards into late game.
Taking more cards dilutes your draw pile of more strikes/defends, and usually you remove them anyway.
And for an act 1 damage card, it's alright. Ignoring acts 2 and 3 there is just better options imo, as towards the end of act 1 this regularly starts feeling pretty weak.
like by the 1st boss this card is already falling off pretty bad.
This card also doesn't activate <high noon> or scale from <maintenance> so it doesn't do especially well in strike/defend builds either.
